name: Quigley, Appellant, v. Board of Pensions of United Presbyterian Church in the United States of America
name_abbreviation: Quigley v. Board of Pensions of United Presbyterian Church in the United States

judges: Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
Mr. Justice Cohen took no part in the decision of this case.
Mr. Justice Pomeroy took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
parties: Quigley, Appellant, v. Board of Pensions of United Presbyterian Church in the United States of America.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
Judgment affirmed.
Mr. Justice Cohen took no part in the decision of this case.
Mr. Justice Pomeroy took no part in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Max D. Palitz and D’Arnold Davis, with them Zion, Chaven and Blount, for appellant.
Donald 0. Hovey, with him Fronde 0. Schilpp, and Bombo and Maiv, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Quigley, Appellant, v. Board of Pensions of United Presbyterian Church in the United States of America.
Argued December 1, 1970.
Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
Max D. Palitz and D’Arnold Davis, with them Zion, Chaven and Blount, for appellant.
Donald 0. Hovey, with him Fronde 0. Schilpp, and Bombo and Maiv, for appellee.
January 7, 1971:
